characters: THE BALL FLIES FROM HER HAND AS SHE CRASHES TO THE GROUND
BROTHER WHO WAS WATCHING MONICA'S GAME FROM THE GYM DOORW
SHE WEARS BOXERS AND QUINCY'S OLD PRACTICE SHIRT. AFTER
CAMILLE STARES AT IT, TAKEN IN BY THE PURE JOY IN HER
FACE-FIRST. SHE GRABS HER CHEEK. BLOOD SLIPS THROUGH HE

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: "FIRST QUARTER" then "1981"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upper middle-class neighborhood, known as the Black Beverly Hills.  Big houses, green grass and Caddies in ev other driveway.  The street is quiet, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be Kareem? CAMERA REVEALS: QUINCY MCCALL, eleven years old, dribblin basketball in front of KELVIN and JAMAL, also eleven.  He sports a fro, a "Clippers" jersey, and a serious swagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All his big butt do is stand by the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, I'll be blocking your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be like Dr. J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma be like my Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't a star or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see none of your sorry daddies in the NBA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, Q. Quincy follows Kelvin's eyes, to a beat-up pair of Conver All-Stars approaching from next door.  Walking in the kic is a YOUNG KID in a T-shirt and Tuff-skins, and a LAKERS pulled low.  A moving van is parked in the driveway. KELVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought only girls were moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what my Moms said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he can ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet he's a scrub. The Kid stops at the edge of Quincy's driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm nice. Quincy looks the Kid up and down, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Kelvin gainst me and Jamal. Quincy tosses the Kid the ball.  The Kid pulls off the baseball cap.  Brown hair tumbles down, framing a soft br face and bright eyes.  She is MONICA WRIGHT, eleven years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah man, he is a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls can't play no ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball better than you. Quincy laughs derisively as Monica walks to the top of th driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dog. Monica shoots him a glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh uh, they could only hear dog whistles. Monica starts to dribble.  Jamal whistles as he walks backwards, guarding her.  She throws up a shot.  IT'S AN AIRBALL.  Quincy and Jamal crack up.  Kelvin rolls his ey Quincy grabs the rebound and shoots.  Swish. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, zip. He rolls the ball to Monica.  She starts dribbling and ag Jamal just backs up with her.  She passes to Kelvin.  Jam and Quincy collapse on him, leaving Monica open under the basket.  Trapped Kelvin has no choice but to pass it back Monica catches the ball and throws up a shot.  It banks o the backboard...AND DROPS THROUGH THE NET.  The boys look her in shock.  Monica tosses the ball back to Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky. Quincy easily dribbles by Kelvin and lays up the ball.  H throws the ball back to Monica. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, one. Monica dribbles.  Jamal plays her a little tighter.  Moni bounces the ball through his open legs and lays up the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, up. Quincy can't believe it.  Kelvin cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah, she dogged you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. The game continues, with Quincy and Monica trading basket for their teams.  Quincy grows agitated with Jamal, who i unable to stop her.  The score hits nine, nine. Quincy stands at the top of the driveway, ball in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point. Quincy dribbles through his legs, then pops an outside sh The ball bounces on the rim...and rolls off. Quincy curses as Monica grabs the rebound and clears the ball.  Jamal moves to guard her, but Quincy shoves him of QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her. Quincy defends.  Monica smiles back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you I was nice.  I'm going to be the first girl in the NBA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma be in the NBA.  You're gonna be my cheerleader. Monica suddenly passes to Kelvin, sprints for the basket. Quincy stumbles, giving her a step.  Kelvin throws it bac Quincy knows he's beat as Monica goes for the winning lay In desperation, he swings at her for the hard foul, shovi her off balance.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERS.
dialogues.text: The boys stand frozen.  Quincy stares down at her, his ey wide with fear...and regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica leans over the sink as her mother, CAMILLE, 36, wi the blood from her face with a washcloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeew. Her sister, LENA, 14, leans in the doorway, making a face She is a mirror of their mother, with relaxed hair and painted nails. Her father, NATHAN, 39, moves behind Lena, holding a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, munchkin? Monica nods.  He smiles. NATHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs to stop running around like a little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she alright looking the way she does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, she'll be fine. He gives Monica a wink, crosses away.  Monica pulls the washcloth away from her Mom and starts wiping the blood herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some ice. She exits.  Lena shakes her head, follows. Monica pulls the washcloth from her face and stares into mirror.  TORN SKIN SURROUNDS A SMALL DEEP GASH IN HER CHE Seeing her latest battle scar, there's only one thing lef for this little girl to do.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy sits at the kitchen table, writing "I AM SORRY" in block letters across a homemade card.  His face is tight concentration as he tries to write in a straight line. At the counter, his mom, NONA, moves a cake from its stor box to a cake dish.  She is 30, beautiful, with effort. smooths the frosting with a spoon. ZEKE, 32, with the height and ego of an NBA ballplayer, enters.  He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, who you trying to fool? Quincy looks up, smiles.  He quickly grabs a piece of crumpled paper, and tosses it to Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley-oop, Dad. Nona intercepts his pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy... She points him back to his card.  Quincy scowls, starts writing again.  Nona scoops some frosting on her finger, holds it up. NONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New neighbors. Zeke wraps his lips around her finger, sucks the frosting off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Quincy, this is how your Moms caught me, with the old fake and bake.  Had me thinking I was getting a sister who could burn. Nona laughs, pulls him down for a kiss.  Quincy suddenly throws down his pencil in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this shit. Zeke and Nona pull away, stare at Quincy in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, what'd I tell you about using that word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Can't" should never be in a man's vocabulary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause when you say can't, you ain't a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and, uh, don't say "shit." Nona just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should head over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you and Quincy, baby.  I got a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got back from a four game road trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nona, don't start bitching.  I got maybe two years left to play.  I'm just trying to put some things together for us. Zeke grabs his keys. ZEKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, Dad. Zeke exits.  Nona leans against the counter, concerned. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille and Nona stand among the piles of boxes.  Monica Quincy stand at their mothers' sides, stealing glances at each other.  A large bandage covers Monica's cheek.  Moni holds her card, Camille holds the cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we moved back here when Quincy was about five, after Zeke was traded. Neighborhood was a little more mixed back then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the Black family down the street became the Black family next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Camille tries to smooth down Monica's unruly hair.  Monic moves her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks again.  This was really nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the least we could do.  And I love to cook. Quincy looks up at his Mom, surprised.  She quickly hugs face into her stomach.  Camille lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, me too.  I used to cook for my friends' parties and things back in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a caterer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, but once Nathan gets settled and the girls get a little older, it's definitely something I want to do. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you love to cook, maybe it's something we can talk about. Quincy snickers.  Nona quickly changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, girl, long as I've lived next door, I've never seen the inside of this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Well, come on, then. Camille hands Monica the cake. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, put this in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help her, Quincy. Camille and Nona head down the hall, leaving Monica and Quincy alone.  The two just stand there. Quincy reaches out, scoops a finger of frosting, and pops in his mouth.  Beat, then Monica takes a bigger scoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this big hole.  You could almost see bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Quincy is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how come you could play basketball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew a girl that could play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom says she doesn't know where I come from 'cause I act different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Dad play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works at a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad plays for the "Clippers."  He says I'ma be a doctor or a lawyer, but I'ma play for them, too.  Same number and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be number thirty-two, like Magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alright, but my Dad can take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the most points your Daddy ever got in Junior High?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time Magic scored forty-eight points, and they only had six minute quarters and he sat out the whole fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do act different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if anybody bothers you, you could just tell me cause I run this street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just tell my sister, Lena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't know how to box, I bet.  My dad showed me how to fight like Ali. He shows off a flurry of punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I know karate from "Almighty Isis." Monica puts the cake down on a box, does a couple of kick and hand movements.  Quincy is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you can't do this though. Quincy does a jump kick.  Monica does the same. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how bout this? Quincy takes a couple steps back, then does a cartwheel. looks great, until he crashes into the box with the cake. The cake falls onto his head and shoulder. Monica doubles over, laughing.  Quincy is embarrassed. Camille and Nona rush back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nona)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all that work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...it's okay.  Can I get a towel? Camille quickly crosses into the kitchen.  Quincy stares the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Nona bends down, whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits between Lena's legs, grimacing, as Lena works comb through her freshly washed, kinky hair.  Monica's he flops like a rag doll.  Her eyes are wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Lena keeps tugging. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, Lena!!! Monica punches her in the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Lena yanks Monica's head back as Camille enters, carrying yellow dress on a hanger.  Monica sees it and her face fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lucky I found it.  Someone put your box of dresses under a pile of rags in the garbage. Monica sulks.  Lena cackles in her ear.  Camille has to laugh. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child, pick up your lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you don't like this one, which one would you rather wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pants. Camille rubs her temples, then hangs the dress on the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lena)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're done can you make sure she brushes her teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to lay down.  I've been running around all day. Just then, Nathan enters.  He holds up two dress shirts a it were a matter of life and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one for tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Camille nods.  Nathan looks at both of them, then: NATHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you iron both tonight just in case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, sweetheart. He kisses her on the cheek, hands her the two shirts and crosses out.  Monica just watches.  Beat, then Camile tur back to her daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy next door is riding with you to school so you'll know somebody your first day. (to Lena)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry so she can go to sleep. Monica reacts, surprised.  Camille leaves.  Lena puts the comb back to Monica's hair.  Beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it look nice, kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basketball posters, "Clippers" and USC memorabilia, a basketball globe light. Quincy lays tucked in bed, eyes wide open, listening to h parents MAKING LOVE.  The sounds bring a smile to his fac Quincy climbs out of bed, wearing underwear.  He moves to window, sees Monica through her window directly across fr his.  Her eyes are closed as Lena braids her hair.  Quinc kneels down, rests his arms on the window sill, and watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy sits atop his BMX bike in front of Monica's house. basketball is tucked under his arm. Monica emerges, walking her banana-seater.  She is lookin cute in her yellow dress and braids tied with ribbons.  A basketball sits in her back basket. Quincy is taken aback, stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be my girl? Monica blinks in surprise.  She thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess, you know, we play ball and we ride to school together.  And if you get mad at me, I gotta give you flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bout Twinkies?  My mom won't ever buy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. An awkward beat between the new couple.  Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we gotta kiss now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five seconds. The two glance around, then climb off their bikes and wal the secluded area between their two houses. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Monica nods.  They lean in, eyes wide open, and touch lip Quincy counts to five with his fingers.  They pull away, embarrassed, and walk back to the driveway. Monica lifts her bike from the ground and climbs on. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Cause you're my girl now you gotta ride my bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ride my own bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad always drives my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that means I have to ride with you. Monica doesn't move. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to do what you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, forget you then, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stupid.  And your Daddy plays for the worst team in the NBA. Quincy's face instantly clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time they won, Dr. J. was a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! He shoves her, knocking her off her bike. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna be your boyfriend, you ugly dog! Monica leaps up, her dress now dirty.  She shoves him bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be your girlfriend, big head! They grapple, then fall to the ground swinging...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE.  Men's NCAA Finals.  Michigan State against Indi State.  Magic Johnson against Larry Bird.  Magic drives o Bird, hits a beautiful scoop shot.  He celebrates as he j back down court...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: "SECOND QUARTER" then "1988"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snarling Black cougar glares down from a large mural. the court below, a girl's basketball play-off game. The bleachers are almost half-full with a hyped crowd.  I the crowd are Monica's parents.  Her father is excited an vocal.  Her mom reads a book.  Also in the stands, the HE COACH OF THE TENNESSEE LADY VOLS, PAT SUMMIT. A fine-ass BROTHER leans in the doorway, sporting a lette jacket with an embroidered "Q" on the chest.  He gets as attention as the game.  A couple of JUNIOR VARSITY CHEERLEADERS smile his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "U", "G", "L", "Y", you ain't got no alibi, you ugly, yeah, yeah, you ugly. "M", "A", "M", "A", how you think you got that way, your Mama, yeah, yeah, your Mama. On the floor, MONICA, dribbles down court.  Just EIGHTEEN her athletic figure has a few curves, but her loose jerse does little to show it off.  Her hair is a mess and her k are dark with bruises.  A small scar is visible on her ch She whips a no-look, around the back pass to a cutting TEAMMATE under the basket, who scores.  The crowd cheers. Monica defends the opposing point guard like a gnat.  She knocks the ball loose and grabs it up.  She goes for a la and the opposing guard steps in front of her.  Monica cra into her, knocking both to the floor. A WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No basket!  Offensive foul, number thirty- two. Monica leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  She wasn't set! The referee ignores her. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was still moving! From the sideline, COACH HISERMAN waves frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica!  Let it go! Monica stares down the ref as she jogs back on defense. The opposing guard drives the lane and puts up a shot. Monica leaps and blocks it with a taunting scream.  A WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technical foul!  Number thirty-two. Coach Hiserman slams down his clipboard.  Monica charges referee.  A teammate grabs at her but she pushes her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taunting?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sub!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you suck! The referee whips back around, whistle in mouth.  Coach Hiserman grabs her arm and pulls her off the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and shut up. Monica slams down in a chair, sweat pouring, hands clench Her mom watches from the stands, completely embarrassed. brother in the doorway turns, leaves. Monica looks up at the clock.  SIX MINUTES LEFT IN THE TH QUARTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, still benched, sits slumped in her chair, her swe on, her face dry.  She glances up at the clock.  TWENTY SECONDS LEFT IN THE FOURTH QUARTER.  Her team's up by SIX Her teammates dribble out the clock.  The BUZZER SOUNDS a they dance across the floor.  Monica looks up in the stan COACH SUMMIT IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, now forty-three, stands at the stove stirring a of gumbo.  Lena, 21, and pretty, stands next to her, hold a handful of plates and silverware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and if you want a thicker base, you can cut in a potato or just use a little flour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you use potato? Camille nods as they cross into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table, Monica is in mid-conversation with her dad. Camille and Lena start setting the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you have to talk to Coach for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what am I supposed to say to the man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach from Tennessee was there and he has me riding the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just showing emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that means it's alright for you to act like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Monica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I keep hoping you'll grow out of this tomboy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.  I'm a lesbian. Lena chokes on her drink, cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what you think, isn't it? Cause I'd rather wear a jersey than an apron...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth. Nathan quickly jumps in, tries to clean things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, I think her point is...maybe it's time to start thinking about other things besides basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

HE IS ALSO THE

dialogues.text: I'm an English major.  You like English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was two words. Monica ducks her head, embarrassed.  Jason laughs. JASON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, how come you're so stressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I'm having a good time with you... His arm slides off the back of her chair and onto her shoulders. JASON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me what I have to do to make you have a good time with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mouth is kinda dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll get you some punch. He stands, then. JASON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't jet while I'm gone and leave a glass slipper behind. Monica's face lights up.  Jason smiles. JASON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. He crosses away to the refreshment table.  Monica smiles wider, leans back in her chair with her legs splayed.  Sh catches herself and quickly crosses them. A couple of guys pass by and check her out.  Monica smile wider.  Quincy steps up, holding two cups of punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the DJ's kinda whack, though. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who is this clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't Spalding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you took Shawnee, huh? The DJ puts on "Make It Last Forever" by Keith Sweat. Couples move to the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it was late and she asked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to dance? Jason stands behind her chair.  Monica smiles shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Jason puts down her cup of punch, takes her hand, leads h to the dance floor. Quincy just shakes his head, then crosses to his table, g Shawnee's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. He pulls Shawnee to the middle of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, nervous at first, a little awkward, but Jason gen guides her in a slow circle and she starts to relax. Jason moves his hands down Monica's back, pulling her in closer.  Shawnee snuggles into Quincy's chest, runs her h down his neck.  The heat from bodies grows. Monica and Quincy glance up at the same time and catch ea other's eyes.  They start to look away but find they can' Eyes locked as they dance, they move together, almost fee each other.  Finally, as their bodies turn, they lose sig Monica puts her head to Jason's chest, Quincy slides his hands lower down Shawnee's back.  The music continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Monica are parked up on Mulholland Drive.  LL C J's "I Need Love" plays on the tape deck. Jason has his arm around Monica, ready to make his move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshman year, my free throw percentage was fifty-one percent, cause I was shooting it like a jump shot. Jason leans in, kisses her bare shoulder. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...but then sophomore year I was shooting seventy-five percent from the line. Jason kisses her neck. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...uh, by keeping my feet set and really following through. Jason goes in for the slam dunk.  Kisses Monica on the li It's the first time she's really been kissed.  Jason pull away, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister told me hands off, but I can't help myself... Jason leans in.  Monica closes her eyes, and they kiss so more.  Monica tries to follow his practiced lips. Jason's tongue slides in and their bodies slide down.  Hi hand moves across her breast.  Monica's eyes pop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh.  It's okay. Naive and inexperienced, Monica shuts her eyes tight.

dialogues.speaker: E WRIGHT HOUSE -NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jason's car pulls off, Monica slowly moves to her front d She looks in the living room window.  Her mom is asleep i chair, trying to wait up. Monica catches her reflection in the window.  She glares her made-up face, then wipes at her mouth with her hand. She steps back , walks to her bedroom window.  She pulls open, kicks off her heels and climbs through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica moves to her bed and drops down.  She sits motionl for a beat, then suddenly feels something beneath her.  S reaches for it.  IT'S A LETTER FROM THE USC ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT.  Monica stares at it in her hands... Light suddenly cuts through the darkness.  Monica turns a is surprised to see Quincy standing in the middle of his room, pulling off his jacket.  Monica moves to her window pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst. Quincy looks over.  Beat.  Then he climbs out of his wind drops down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early night for you, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was about to ask you the same thing, going out with a college boy and all. Monica doesn't respond. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where'd you go after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what dead-end street did you and Shawnee hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure she kept her word and left you satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what you think? Monica shrugs. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little after you left, I told Shawnee it was time to go and I drove her ass straight home.  And after she told me I was the dumbest brother in the world, I took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I don't just stick my dick in anything. Monica takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sitting in Jason's ride with him kissing on me and feeling on me and it was really bugging me cause I couldn't remember how many offensive boards I had in the championship.  And then I guess she got tired of me sort of accidentally kneeing him in the balls. Beat, then Quincy cracks up.  Monica laughs with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had four offensive rebounds. Monica stares at him, surprised.  She thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up for a second. Monica disappears back inside.  Beat, then she re-appears She climbs out her window, drops down.  Quincy looks at h She holds out the envelope from USC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was on my bed when I came in. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Monica nods.  Quincy takes the envelope, sits down on the grass.  Monica sits down beside him.  He tears open the envelope and pulls out the letter. Monica stares at him as he reads, trying to see an answer his face.  Quincy finally looks up.  Expressionless. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn girl... Monica's face falls.  And then, a slow smile spreads acro Quincy's face. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want you. Monica grabs the letter, reads.  Her head just drops as a tidal wave of relief washes over her. Quincy smiles. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Monica looks up, cheesing. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be there, too.  I'm announcing tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. Monica can't contain her excitement.  Without thinking, s gives Quincy a kiss.  They pull away, then break into ner laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? But they both want more.  They lean in, kiss deeply.  The fall back on the grass.  And kiss.  And kiss. Suddenly, Monica pulls away, sits up.  Quincy follows, instantly apologetic.  Monica stares at him, then to his surprise, she reaches over, gives his shirt a small tug w her finger. Quincy stares at her, then slowly pulls off his tie.  He nervously unbuttons his shirt.  He fumbles with the last buttons. Monica slowly pulls down the straps of her dress, self- conscious.  Quincy can't keep his eyes off her. He pulls off his pants.  Monica glances down and her eyes widen.  She looks scared to death.  Quincy smiles softly, leans in and gently kisses her.  She relaxes.  They lay d Quincy reaches into his pants for a condom.  His hands sh as he puts it on.  They stare at each other as he moves o top of her. Quincy pushes inside her.  She flinches back in pain.  Qu immediately stops as tears spring to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to stop? Monica shakes her head.  Quincy pushes inside again.  He looks down at her with tenderness, moves gently, kisses h tears...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE.  1988-89 NBA Finals.  Game SEVEN.  The Lakers against the Pistons.  With seconds left, up by three, Mag guards Isiah Thomas.  They collide, no foul is called and Lakers win their second championship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Championship banners hang from the ceiling. TWELVE YOUNG WOMEN sit on the first two rows of bleachers The eight upperclassmen kick back in the second row, comfortable, confident.  Monica and the three other fresh sit in front of them, jiggling nervously. COACH MILLER stands in front of the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know some of you very well yet, and you don't know me because I'm still being nice to you. Laughter from the upperclassmen. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my philosophy is simple. Hard work and sacrifice. There's a lot of basketball history and pride here at USC, but just putting on the cardinal and gold doesn't make you a great player.  Hard work and sacrifice makes you a great player.  What you were doesn't matter anymore.  For the first time in your life, you won't be the best. You'll be going up against women that are bigger and stronger and better than you ever imagined.  So the question is, how will you respond?  Well, your answer better be hard work and sacrifice because that's the only way you're gonna make it through.  Vince Lombardi preached it and I teach it, "There is only one way to succeed at anything and that is to give everything." Coach Miller pauses a moment to let her words sink in. Monica glances at her fellow freshman for their reactions Like her, a lot of cockiness, a lot of fear. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few simple rules.  Eleven o'clock curfew, no exceptions.  Always be on time, no exceptions.  Attend every class, no exceptions.  No drugs, no alcohol, no getting pregnant.  And finally, respect yourselves, respect your coaches and respect your teammates, right Sidra? SIDRA, senior point guard, nods from the second row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the end of this year some of you will hate me... The upperclassmen crack up. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of you will want to go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cat-calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cree! CREE, junior forward, ducks her head sheepishly.  Coach Miller smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guarantee you, if you work hard and sacrifice, all of you will be better basketball players and better people. Monica nods, accepting the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold, it's dark.  It's six a.m. The team pounds down the track, pushing through a two-mil run.  Monica and her freshman teammate/roommate SHAYLA, 1 breathe heavily from the back of the pack. From the sideline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, freshmen, you're getting spanked! Monica sucks it up, runs faster.  She reaches the middle the pack, then runs out of gas.  She drops back to the re COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, I'm putting you on my Wizard of Oz team.  No brains, no courage and no heart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defensive drills.  One by one, players crouch low and mov backwards down the sideline.  ZVETTE, a junior guard, hus through the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to work, Zvette. Monica starts the drill. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lower, Monica, move your feet. Monica grimaces as she squats lower. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said lower! Coach Miller stops her, squats down low beside her. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is low, got it?  Offense sells tickets, defense wins games! Monica starts again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team stands along the baseline.  Monica stands right below the free throw line. TONI, 6'4", 200 pound senior, drives the lane.  Monica st in front of her, and is slammed to the floor.  She lays s for a moment, stunned by the impact.  Laughter from the baseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dag, you took her out, T. Teammates SANDRA and LISA crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she just said "Mommy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she said "mammary."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, you trying to tell me you can't take a little challenge? Monica crawls to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time get your feet set. Monica moves back into position.  Toni drives at her agai Monica steps in front of her, braces herself.  Toni slams into her and she hits the floor.  Monica blinks back the as she pops back up. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next! Monica wobbles back to the sideline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is spread out, lifting weights.  Monica lies on weight bench, her arms shaking as she struggles to bench press fifty-pounds.  Sidra stands behind her, spotting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, c'mon, lift! Monica lifts it with Sidra's help. SIDRA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach hates me, doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates all freshmen. Monica scowls, discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't take it personal.  And don't think just cause we play the same position we have to compete with each other.  We're teammates, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sidra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides.  I've been starting point the last two years.  Ain't no way some dumb- ass freshman is taking my spot. Sidra walks off, leaving Monica with the bar on her chest Finally, she has to drop the weight to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica and Quincy walk to class, his arm draped casually across her shoulders.  Quincy gets looks and smiles.  Mon just looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finish the reading for E-con?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically broke down how I'm gonna make mad loot in the NBA, me being such a limited commodity and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, big head. Quincy laughs.  TWO GIRLS pass by, smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Q-man, you gonna take us to the Final Four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be watching. The girls continue on.  Monica looks at Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do see me standing here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be nice to a fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help girls coming up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said fine. Quincy looks at her sulking.  He suddenly pulls her down the nearby lawn, and cradles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, little baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit. Quincy grips her tighter, rocks her.  Students pass by, laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.  Daddy's here. Monica finally cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a punk. He gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these girls...you're the only one I know who's for real. Monica smiles, kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heated scrimmage between the women's "A" team (the star five) and "B" team (five who want to be starting).  Monic runs point for the "B" team, playing opposite Sidra. Sidra is all over Monica, slipping in cheap shots, but Mo starts to come on.  She does a quick cross-over and loses Sidra.  She dishes off to Shayla, who scores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidra!  You feel like playing any "D"? Sidra scowls as she runs down court.  She gets a pass in corner, tires to make a move but Monica slaps the ball lo Monica grabs it, drives to the three-point line, puts up shot.  SWISH!  Monica stays posed, with her arm up. Sidra takes advantage, sprints back down court.  She get long pass, lays it up.  Coach Miller blows her whistle. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica!  Get over here. Monica jogs over, sheepish. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're so busy posing, your man just scored! Monica drops her head. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love to pose so much, let's see it again. Beat, then Monica holds up her arm like she just shot the ball.  Snickers from her teammates. COACH MILLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to stand like that for the rest of practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to stand like that until you're sick of it because I don't ever want to see it again, you hear me? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dora, take her spot. DORA, freshman, jogs onto the court.  Coach Miller blows whistle and the scrimmage resumes. Monica stands alone on the sideline, posing, and feeling an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits on the bench in front of her locker, dressing after the shower.  Shayla sits next to her. Nearby, Lisa and Sandra apply make-up in the mirror.  Zve passes by, already dressed.  Lisa turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Z, I know you're gonna shower first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smell bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you wonder why your ass sits alone on the bus. Cree glances over from another sink, as she snaps the cha on her CROSS NECKLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys curse too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is "ass" a curse? MAEYEN walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, it's as big as yours. They crack up.  Cree just shakes her head.  Two TEAMMATES pass by Monica with their arms raised, mimicking her pose Monica shakes her head. Sidra glances at Monica from her spot on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you get for trying to show out, freshman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just playing ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were trying to make me look bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have to try very hard. Ears prick up around the locker room.  Sidra stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, don't you know you're just sloppy seconds? Monica rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Toni tries to step in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidra, let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only reason you're here is cause Tonya Randall got pregnant and decided not to come.  They were done recruiting. KELLI, senior forward, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cold, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thought the girl should know. Monica is stunned.  Sidra saunters to the showers.  Shayl nudges her with her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even trip.  She's just mad cause she's bow-legged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica and Quincy lay feet to face on Quincy's twin bed. Monica's hand holds an ice bag on Quincy's hip.  Quincy's rests across an ice bag on Monica's ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Tonya Randall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Coach wishes she was here instead of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then prove her wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it easy like you, alright. There's no red carpet laid out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're gonna act salty all night? Quincy's roommate/teammate REGGIE, 18, suddenly pops his into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, dog, we're about to order some wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, thanks. Reggie shrugs, closes the door.  Quincy looks at Monica, still brooding. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Don't worry about proving everybody wrong, okay?  You can't handle the pressure, I'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was so weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares if you're never known as the first girl in the NBA.  You'll get more play behind Quincy McCall's woman anyway. Monica shoves Quincy's ice bag down his sweat pants.  He leaps up. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah!  Damn, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you get. He smiles as he pulls the ice.  Then looks her up and dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how about a little one-on-one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we playing for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Quincy locks the door, sets up his indoor hoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I score, you strip.  You score, I drop something. Monica looks at him, then cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My court, I go first. Quincy grips the ball.  Monica crouches low on defense. Quincy drives past her and slams down a vicious dunk. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip. Monica makes a face, then pulls off her sweatshirt.  Quin skips back.  Monica drops low again.  Quincy fakes her ou and slams down another vicious dunk.  He laughs. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the "D"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my booty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan to. Monica glares through her smile, then pulls off her T-shi leaving her in a bra and shorts. Quincy goes for another dunk, but this time, Monica reach out, GRABS HIS DICK.  Quincy drops the ball.  Monica pick up and lays it in. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All's fair in love and basketball. Strip. Quincy pulls off his shirt.  Monica moves back into posit Quincy drops down low.  Monica fakes, gets him to leave h feet.  She slips under him and scores.  She laughs. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you got your mama's height, huh. Quincy pulls off his sweats, leaving him in just drawers. Monica takes in the view as she moves back into position. She holds the ball out, taunting.  Quincy pretends to rea for it, but grabs her breast instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my bad. She drives.  Quincy just steps out of the way and lets he score.  Monica snatches the ball off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, where's the "D"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Monica turns, finds Quincy butt-naked.  He moves her agai the wall and kisses her.  Monica drops the ball, wraps he arms around him.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you to. Game over.  They hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sportscaster DICK VITALE talks animatedly about the upcom season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the start of the new college season and I'm like a kid in a candy store.  Too many great teams to choose from.  You have your Dukes', Kentuckys', Arkansas', but my surprise treat this season...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sportscaster ROBIN ROBERTS reports on the upcoming women' season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...USC.  The women of Troy made it to the Sweet Sixteen last year and are returning four starters from that squad.  And many consider their recruiting class one of the best in the nation.  The highlight of that class,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is Quincy McCall, one of my diaper dandies.  He's a real P.T.P., a prime- time player.  Every college in the country wanted him but he chose to follow in his father's footsteps and become a Trojan.  He's gonna have a lot on his shoulders this season...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Coach Cheryl Miller feels that if just one of her freshmen has a breakout year, they can go all the way.  It's a long season, anything can happen, but one thing is for sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be awesome, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred flashbulbs pop as Quincy jogs out to center cou The crowd goes crazy as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits on the bench, watching Sidra run the floor against UNLV, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy drives to the three-point line against Cal and put up.  It drops through the net.  He pounds his fist agains the number twenty-two on his chest, nods to Zeke standing behind the bench, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Miller motions to Monica.  She jumps up, pulls off sweats.  She jogs past Arizona bench and onto the floor, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy goes up for a dunk against North Carolina.  He jam down, grips the rim, and pulls his legs up high, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica catches a long outlet pass.  She drops a no-look bounce pass between two Berkeley defenders, to a teammate scores.  She jogs back, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke grips Quincy's head proudly, affectionately, as they walk off the floor after a game against Washington, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidra crashes to the floor, immediately grabs at her ankl Monica rises off the bench...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Televisions hang from every corner, broadcasting various games. Zeke and Quincy sit at a bar.  Quincy is still hyped from game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...up and under between two defenders, with the left hand.  That's gotta make SportsCenter. Zeke just nods as the Bartender/Owner crosses over.  He i ex-ballplayer named TERRY. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't stop me, Pop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you having, Zeke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genuine Draft.  And an orange juice for my kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross-over's looking good, Quincy.  I know your old man didn't teach you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't need a cross-over to post you up. Terry laughs as he moves off to fix the drinks.  Somethin on Zeke's mind, but before he can speak on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the numbers I'm putting up are better than any freshman.  Some people are saying I'm a definite lottery pick. Zeke suddenly focuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell them to mind their damn business.  You're smart enough to get a degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm also good enough to go pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much higher the play level is in the NBA?  Give yourself time to develop, Quincy.  Get an education.  The NBA ain't going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came out early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom got pregnant and I had to make choices.  You don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Silence, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, the sooner you go pro, the sooner you'll have to deal with the mess I'm dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What mess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there's this thing out there.  This paternity suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some girl that's been hanging on at every party.  now I'm supposed to be her baby's Daddy. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I told your mom I wanted to be the one who told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's not true, is it? Zeke stares at his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the balls to ask me that? Quincy can't hold his father's look.  Zeke shakes his hea hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need to hear me say it, I'll say it.  It's not true. Quincy looks in his father's eyes, knows he's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this thing to go to court, but my lawyer's telling me to settle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A case like this could hang around for months and I'm up for this player relations job with the "Clips."  This gets out, false or not, no one'll touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Mom think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't exactly been living the fairy- tale life the past few years.  Something like this happens, it either brings a family closer or pushes them further apart.  We'll just have to see how it plays out. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving her some space, couple days... Just then, a COLLEGE STUDENT approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Q-man, great game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. The student holds out a piece of paper, without even a gl to Zeke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get an autograph? Quincy nods, signs the guy's paper.  Zeke watches his son the rising star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windows, we see Quincy enter the house.  He glances around, then walks to the living room.  He sees h mom sitting outside by the pool, drink in hand, looking t up.  He pulls open the sliding glass door.  Nona jumps, t sees Quincy.  She quickly puts her drink down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Quincy glances at her half-hidden glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I remember you drinking was when Marvin Gaye died. No response from Nona. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This about Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he talked to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it, okay.  Sooner or later the truth'll come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose truth are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we can't let something like this mess up the family. She doesn't respond.  Quincy studies her. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you believe him, right? Nona sits silent, humiliated. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just about money, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, how many times have you told me yourself to watch out for these ho's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I should have been telling your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're gonna take the word of some trick over Pop's?  He wouldn't lie. Nona grabs an envelope beside her and throws it at him. Confused, Quincy opens it.  HE PULLS OUT A COUPLE OF PHOT Zeke outside a party.  IN ONE PHOTO, his arm is around a young woman.  IN ANOTHER PHOTO, they KISS.  AND YET ANOTH they climb into his car. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hired somebody.  How pathetic is that? After all his late nights and "meetings" and I still needed proof. Quincy just stares at the photos. NONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think I was lucky just to be married to Zeke McCall, but I'm too tired. Quincy looks stricken, but he moves to Nona, comforts her she cries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits with a devastated Quincy, high up in the bleachers.  In the distance, the clock-tower glows 10:50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put your hands in your pockets, hold your head up, always look a man in the eye, and all the time I'm hanging on his every word like he's God or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he messed up, but that doesn't change what he's been to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has he been to me?  I mean, he looked me in my face and lied like it was nothing.  Like it was easy. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm standing there getting loud on my mom like she's the one with no sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He even had me wanting to play for the "Clippers."  Man, how stupid am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a lot of brothers dog their wives, I just never thought my pops would do some shit like this... Monica puts her arms around him.  They sit there, quiet. Monica glances up at the clock tower.  She reacts.  Quinc notices. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we walk to my dorm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not up for running into anybody. Let's just kick it here, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach has us on eleven o'clock curfew. If I'm late, I don't suit up. Quincy looks at her, almost in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't realize you were watching the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I can stay a few more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  Don't sweat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real.  I should be alone, anyway. Monica reluctantly stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you call me when you get in? Quincy nods.  Monica gives him a kiss.  Then she turns an crosses away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off but Monica sits up in bed.  SHE WEARS BOXERS AND ONE OF QUINCY'S PRACTICE SHIRTS. Shayla lies under her covers across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen him, Shay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon, Sidra's out for one game, and you got the start.  But you get caught breaking curfew and Coach is gonna send your ass back to the bench.  You'll see your man tomorrow. Shayla's warning slowly sinks in.  Finally, Monica lays d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock tower glows 12:30.  Quincy still sits in the bleachers.  Alone.  Tears fill his eyes as his world come crashing down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: USC vs. Louisiana Tech.  The packed crowd is hyped.  Nath sits by himself in the stands, excited. Monica sits on the bench with four of her teammates.  The rest of the team is lined up in front of them, including Sidra in street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the starting line-up for your Women of Troy!  At center, a senior, Toni Noise! Toni rises, jogs through the line of teammates to the cou ANNOUNCER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At forward, a senior, Lisa Mason! Lisa stands, skips through the line. ANNOUNCER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At forward, a junior, Zvette Mitchell! Zvette jumps up, bumps into each teammate as she moves do the line. ANNOUNCER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At guard, a freshman, Monica Wright! Monica takes a deep breath, then jogs through the line. gets to the middle of the floor and looks around with her game face on. ANNOUNCER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at guard, a sophomore, Sandra Perez! Sandra jogs out and the rest of the team follows.  Everyo gathers in a tight circle with their arms around each oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look y'all, we got all these people here to see big-bad, La Tech.  We need to let them know that this is our house.  So everybody better leave everything out on that floor, you got that?  Ready?  One, two, three....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sellout crowd for the men's SC/Temple game.  And Quincy having the worst game of his life. He drives down court on a fast break.  He ignores his two open teammates and puts up a three-pointer.  It hits noth but air.  The crowd boos. Humiliated, Quincy tries to steal the ball back and commi stupid foul.  His teammates glare at him as they line up free throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica's game.  Late second half.  SC down two. Monica drives the lane, drawing two defenders.  She looks like she's about to force up a shot, then suddenly whips pass to a wide-open Sandra at the three-point line.  Noth but net.  SC up one. Coach Miller claps intensely on the sideline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, that's it! Ten seconds left.  Game on the line.  Monica tries to lob pass inside to Toni.  The pass is knocked away and grabbe by the opposing point guard. It is a one-on-one between Monica and the guard.  The gir drives hard for the winning hoop.  Monica races to the ke and slides in front of her.  The guard goes up and slams Monica.  Both crash to the floor as the ball drops throug the net and the buzzer goes off. A WHISTLE.  The two women stare up at the REFEREE from th floor.  And then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Offensive foul!  Charging!  No basket! Monica leaps up as the crowd goes crazy.  Toni grabs up Monica in a hug as their teammates celebrate around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy drags himself to his bench, slumps down dejectedly the Temple Owls celebrate their win around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female players continue to celebrate as they undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, you see that crowd?  We need to be playing in the Sports Arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. They give each other a pound. Lisa looks at Monica, standing in her shorts and sports b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh damn, Mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think ol' girl took out your chi-chis with that charge. The women break into laughter.  Monica smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I think she took that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra, please, last time you chest- bumped me, it took you three tries. More laughter.  Monica looks over at Toni, sitting quietl the bench. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, T, why you so quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go play overseas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were hyped about going to Portugal next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never gonna be like this.  Playing in front of my family, hanging out with my girls.  Probably not even a McDonald's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, there's always a McDonald's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you got an offer.  My agent's still looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it'd be worth it if I knew some day I could come back here and play.  But for right now, it's law school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica. Monica turns, sees Coach Miller standing in her office doorway.  She motions for her.  Monica heads over.  Sidra watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trophies, plaques and photos fill every empty space. Coach Miller sits behind her desk.  Monica stands before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've given up after you threw that ball away.  But you kept your head and you showed real heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got our final games against Oregon and Oregon State and I want to shake things up a bit, so I'm starting you at point again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Sidra's ankle was okay for next game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the job or not? Realization finally hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Yes. Monica looks at Coach Miller completely thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...it seems like you're always yelling at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd go hoarse for a player with no potential?   When I ignore you, that's when you worry. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get dressed. Monica nods, crosses out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Monica walks back to her teammates, Coach Miller steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidra. Sidra looks at Monica as she rises, crosses over.  Monica avoids her eyes as they pass.  Sidra enters the office an the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo sis, what's going on? Beat, then Monica smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black folks pack the cramped houseparty, bumping to a pha hip hop joint. Monica bounces through the throng.  A GIRL grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, great game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Another PARTY-GOER grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, you can play. Monica smiles wider.  She spots Reggie dancing in the cro moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reg.  You seen Quincy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek said Q was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll roll through. Monica is suddenly pulled into a dance routine by Sandra Lisa. She laughs, tires to move away, but they won't let her go Monica gives in, grooves with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy walks through the door with a half-empty forty in hand.  Girls immediately try to grab his attention from t dance floor, or stare him down from the sidelines. Quincy sees Monica on the dance floor.  He stands, watchi her.  Takes a drink.  Monica finally looks over, sees him She smiles, crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to find you all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am. She glances at the forty in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens, right... Shayla suddenly grabs Monica from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Monica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, superstar. (then, to Quincy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your girl was on tonight.  She tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She also tell you she ganked the starting spot from Sidra? Monica looks at him for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. He downs the last of his forty. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the keg at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balcony. He heads for the glass doors.  Monica and Shayla follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie approaches the group.  Gives Quincy a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, dog? (to Shayla)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, flyness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off the bra strap, Reggie, you're a ho. He laughs, then turns back to Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach is gonna kill us in practice tomorrow.  Might even pull his lips off your dick, limp as your game was tonight. Quincy just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny. Monica leans against Quincy, affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he's just playing, Q...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think for once we could talk about something besides basketball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever's clever. Silence.  Reggie and Shayla crack up.  Quincy shakes his head, moves to the keg line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all need to quit. She starts for Quincy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica. Monica looks over, sees Sidra standing in the doorway.  T is no escaping this confrontation.  She glances at Quincy then crosses over.  Quincy turns, sees her disappear back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to say good game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts.  Took a lot of heart to take that charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was a dumb-ass pass to Toni. Ten seconds left, you run out the clock. Monica shakes her head.  An awkward silence. SIDRA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be lying if I said I wasn't pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one word of advice for next season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never let a freshman take your spot. Sidra turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy takes one long drink from his cup.  KERRY, 20, and spandexed, stands directly in front of him, flirtatiously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He steps aside as she tries to work the keg.  Nothing com out.  She nods at his cup, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's the last beer, you and I are sharing. Shayla glances over as Quincy pumps the keg a couple of times.  Kerry hands him her cup and he starts filling it KERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like watching you play.  Number twenty- two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you didn't see the game. Quincy knows he should blow her off, but he's digging the attention.  He hands her back her cup. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica looks over at Quincy and sees him talking to the hoochie.  The girl looks too damn comfortable.  Monica mo back outside. KERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you.  Q-man. She swishes past Monica.  Shayla "accidentally" bumps her Kerry glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's nobody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this party's whack.  You ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. He leans in, kisses her drunkenly.  She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could finish what we were talking about last night. Quincy kisses her again. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Q...
dialogues.text: (pushing him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy, quit.  You're drunk. They fall silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
