dialogues.text: You know what, I'm just gonna crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...Maybe I'll come by later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I have curfew. He starts to walk away, then stops. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way.  Congratulations. He goes.  Monica stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy pushes through his front door, then stops short in doorway.  Zeke sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your door was unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still is, so let yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't got nothing to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I messed up, okay, I know that.  But I ain't that kid's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I ain't saying it was right, but sometimes things happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some things should never fucking happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you're so perfect you can look down on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't a damn liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom was real quick to show you those pictures, wasn't she? Well, she was nineteen when she got pregnant and don't get me wrong, you're the best thing in my life, but she knew I wasn't ready for no marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you're saying my mother trapped you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying I handled my responsibilities like a man.  But when you're in the NBA, you pull into a city and there's a hundred women waiting at the hotel.  And another twenty that made it past security on your floor.  And the boldest one is standing right at your door.  And after awhile, it just becomes part of the game. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I lied to you, I shouldn't have.  But I did it cause I love you. Zeke looks at his son, meaning every word.  Quincy stares back, long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since we're being honest, guess I should tell you.  I'm dropping out of school and going pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Quincy just stares back. ZEKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy, you'd be making the biggest mistake of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know your mad at me, okay, but I can't let you do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always thought "can't" wasn't in a man's vocabulary. Zeke is taken aback by the hatred in his son's eyes.  He turns and without another word, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy stands across the street from the houseparty, star up at the balcony.  Monica leans against the railing, laughing with a couple of teammates.  Quincy watches her, then turns and walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION.  Monica's eyes are on fire as she races an Oregon player for a loose ball.  Both dive for it, slide across the floor.  Monica grabs it up, screams for a time as her opponent tries to wrestle away the ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica walks down the hall to Quincy's suite.  The window open.  The sounds of Nintendo are heard.  She walks in without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie sits on the couch with a TEAMMATE, playing Nintend "Duck Hunt".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, y'all. They barely give her a nod.  Monica crosses into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy stands at an ironing board, ironing a T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't at my game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry about that.  I had this meeting with this guy. Quincy pulls on the T-shirt. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hit a three at the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "man" again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman... A knock at the front door.  Quincy exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica follows, then stops short.  Kerry, the spandexed g from the party, stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Quincy gives her a hug.  Monica stares at him in disbelie Reggie and his teammate smack each other, "Oh shit!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Kerry, this is Monica.  Monica, Kerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You stay, I'll leave. She storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!  Monica slams her car door.  Her face is a mask of a and confusion. Camille exits the house, car keys in hand.  She sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica.  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know I needed a reason to come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be defensive.  I'm just surprised to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still at the bank. Monica glowers.  Camille looks at her. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly not)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Camille just nods, doesn't bother asking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm going to get dinner. She pulls open her car door.  Beat, then... CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you lose, you get this attitude. But it's just a game. Monica rolls her eyes, as her mom leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy sits on the wall outside of Monica's dorm, as Moni slowly makes her way up the walk.  She sees him, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to your new girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just took the ho to Burger King, alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least she had time for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you fucked around to prove a point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said I didn't fuck around.  But you got your head so far up your ass it took a cheap date for you to notice me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, "Q-man", did I forget to kiss your ass like everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night you wanted to talk about your Dad I had a curfew.  What was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I stayed, I wouldn't be starting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you got your priorities straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked you to choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a ballplayer.  If anyone knows what that means it should be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if all you care about is basketball, why you fucking me?  Go fuck Dick Vitale. Monica punches the shit out of Quincy, then pushes past h Quincy grabs her arm, stopping her. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up.  I'm sorry, alright. They stand, silent.  Trying to come down from their anger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know next time you're feeling neglected or whatever, you're not going to run around on me?  If we're going to be together I have to be able to trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking for us to be together. Monica flinches in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going through a lot of shit right now, more than you have time for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to tell me what I have time for?  I mean, whatever I did...we can fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm entering the draft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided to go pro.  And who knows where I'll end up, you know? Monica's heart is sinking fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you decide all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it, just forget about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnitt, Monica.  This ain't about us anymore, it's about me. Monica is crushed.  Beat as, Quincy struggles to stay col QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you know, I'd still like us to be friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends. She fights back tears.  Quincy has to look away.  Monica can't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...I guess I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Beat, then Quincy turns and walks away.  Monica tries to fight her tears but her pain, hurt and confusion are too much.  Finally, she gives in, and the tears fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE.  Press conference.  Magic sits beside his wife Cookie.  He shocks the world as he announces his retireme from basketball.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: "FOURTH QUARTER" then "1993"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madrid, Pampolona, the running of the bulls, old-world architecture. Finally, we rest on a large billboard, a photo of Monica basketball uniform, drinking a Spanish soft-drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica jogs down the congested cobble-stone street, a spo bag over her shoulder.  She is TWENTY-THREE.  Half-assed braids frame her matured features. She passes store fronts, street vendors, and dodges pedestrians, as she makes her way toward a large, older arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited crowd jockeys for position at the front doors. Above them, a huge banner reads "Campeonato de Europeo". (European Championships".) As Monica heads for the back entrance, a cheer goes up fr large contingent in the crowd.  Monica smiles, waves back TWO LITTLE GIRLS break from line, run to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baloncesto!  Balencesto!  (Basketball! Basketball!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oye. They giggle, hold out a piece of paper and a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autografo. As Monica signs her autograph, a tall woman carrying a matching sports bag approaches.  She is LUISA, Spanish, 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick Spanish accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica.  What is up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oye, Luisa. Monica hands the girls her autograph and they run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large game, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.  Large game. They duck into the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint peels off the walls.  Windows are broken overhead. Monica sits alone at her locker, taping her own ankles. TEN TEAMMATES, all from Spain, sit on the surrounding benches, talking and joking among themselves in Spanish. Monica is clearly an outsider. COACH PARRA, Spanish, late 40's, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silenco! The women immediately stop talking.  COACH PARRA gives an animated, impassioned speech in Spanish.  Monica doesn't understand a word, just continues taping her ankles. Coach Parra finishes and the women clap, pumped up. Monic turns to Luisa, seated next to her on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say to give the ball to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arena is PACKED with a raucous European crowd, chanti and waving signs - the love their women's basketball. Monica walks onto the floor, tucking her jersey into her shorts.  The uniforms are old-style - polyester and tight Her club's name is stitched on the front, "GODELLA". As she hits center court, a smile suddenly breaks through game face.  Standing opposite her, playing for the opposi Italian club is Sidra, HER RIVAL FROM USC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Sidra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna love winning this championship in your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you say "you're dreaming" in Italian? They move into position.  The ball is tossed up.  Italy w the tip and the ball is passed to Sidra. Monica hounds her as she brings up the ball.  Sidra shove her off and to the floor, and scores.  No whistle.  Women pro ball is at a whole other level.  Bigger, better, toug The ball is passed in to Monica.  She drives down court, up for a lay up.  An Italian player shoves Monica in mid- taking out her legs.  Monica crashes on the hardwood. A whistle.  Monica lays still for a moment, then pushes herself up and walks to the free-throw line without a wor Without emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge crowd dances fervently to the live Spanish music. the middle of the floor, the Spanish players are the life the party. In a corner, Monica sits with Sidra, drinking and watchin the festivities.  A large trophy sits on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take that damn thing off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean my championship trophy?  My bad. Monica sets it down in the seat next to her, puts an arm around it.  Sidra shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a cocky bitch. Monica laughs.  She downs her drink, motions to the waite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uno mas, por favor. The waiter nods. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last I heard, you were playing in Sweden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, four years ago.  They had me staying in this tiny-ass town with like fifty people.  I'm not playing, there was about a thousand goats running around, and it gets dark at four o'clock.  Then the whack club I'm on loses three games in a row and I get blamed.  So they fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.  So I've been playing with this Italian club the last three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better.  Even though the whole first season my teammates didn't pass to me cause they were mad "The American" was making more money. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I led the team in rebounds cause it was the only way I could touch the damn ball. Monica laughs as the waiter brings her drink.  She tries pay, but he just shakes his head, crosses away. SIDRA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us don't win championships our first year overseas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I went through the same drama as everybody else.  I mean, the first four months, only person I could talk to was this chick Luisa, who knew like ten words of English from watching old "Dif'rent Strokes" reruns.  Swear to God, I had to tell her if she said, "What you talking bout, Willis?" one more time, I was gonna kick her ass. Sidra laughs.  They watch the madness out on the dance fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are these Spanish guys like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You've been over here seven months and you ain't tapped anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just not my type, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, Italian boys love them some black women.  They can't get enough of me. Monica smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  But what's the alternative, not playing?  You remember big Toni? (off Monica's nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quit last year, now she's working at some bookstore.  I mean, look at us. They treat us like we're Hollywood stars over here.  We just played in the championship game.  It doesn't get much sweeter than this. Monica takes this in.  Her eyes do not reflect someone on of the world.  She takes a long drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, sparse, one-bedroom.  Sam, Diane and the rest of gang from "Cheers" fill the small TV screen that flickers the darkness.  Their dialogue is dubbed in Spanish. Monica sits on the floor, braiding her hair.

dialogues.speaker: YEARS, IT IS WELL-WORN.
dialogues.text: Feelings of loneliness threaten to swallow her whole.  Sh looks out her window and sees her billboard, looming in t distance.  She just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts as a Laker player dunks the ball on a fa break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laker announcers CHICK HEARN and STU LANTZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, this game is in the refrigerator. The door is closed, the lights are out, the butter's hard and the Jell-Oooooo's jigglin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here come the subs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy pulls off his sweats and jogs onto the court with rest of the subs.  He is twenty-three, a man.  His goatee tired eyes make him look older.  HE NOW WEARS NUMBER TWEN ONE. STU LANTZ (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see these guys get a little playing time.  And the fans love it. Quincy immediately gets a pass in the corner.  He puts up quick three and it banks hard off the rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chick and Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-pointer is off for the kid from SC.  Came out after his freshman year, now in his fifth year with the league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The son of Zeke McCall, played twelve years with the Clippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good player.  The kid's moved around quite a bit, but he's hoping to finally have a home with the Lakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy steals the ball, has nothing but open court ahead him. CHICK HEARN (cont'd) (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, folks, it's showtime. Quincy takes off from the hash-mark and throws down a mon jam.  He swings high off the rim.  Too high.  His hand sl and he crashes to the floor.  His knee twists at a sicken angle. The dwindling crowd gasps as Quincy clutches his left kne writhing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke walks down the corridor, checking room numbers.  He forty-five now.  His slight paunch as become a roll. He sees Nona exiting a room, with an empty water pitcher hand.  Her hair is in locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nona. Nona looks over.  Her eyes narrow. ZEKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, not great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nona, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tore his ACL. Zeke's shoulders slump.  Then he looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost didn't recognize you with your hair like that.  How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy.  And he won't want to see you. Nona walks over to a MAN standing nearby.  He puts an arm around her and they move down the hall.  Zeke watches for beat, then pulls open Quincy's door, steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy lays in the bed.  His knee is bandaged and propped by pillows.  He stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, son. Quincy turns, sees his father.  He turns back to the wind ZEKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you made SportsCenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came by to check on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remember that being my fault. Seems like you divorced me same time as your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.  I know things look pretty bleak right now, but you can't get down on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped taking your advice a long time ago, or did you forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy.  I know you left school early to throw your middle finger up at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm paying for it, right?  That what this is about?  "I told you so?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to fuck off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll fuck off, but not til I say something. Silence.  Then. ZEKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a better ballplayer than I ever was.  But you got a lot of other things going for you.  You're smart.  I always felt...I always knew that you could do anything you wanted.  You want to be a ballplayer, be a ballplayer.  Just know you ain't like everybody else on that court.  You ain't like I was.  You got options.  That's all I ever tried to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still trying to tell me what I should and shouldn't do.  How come you couldn't be the man you kept trying to make me? Zeke stares at his son, wishing he could satisfy him with answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just couldn't With nothing left to say, Zeke pulls open the door and leaves.  Quincy stares at the door long after it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE enters, carrying a bouquet of flowers.  She moves past the empty bed, puts them on a table already overflow with flowers.  She pulls open the blinds and light floods room.  She crosses back out. A toilet flush.  Beat, then Quincy slowly hops out of the bathroom, scratching his bare ass through the opening of gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought this was gonna be awkward. Quincy whips around and is shocked to see Monica standing there, laughing.  She has clearly made an effort with her appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica? He stumbles.  Monica quickly goes to him, catches his arm before he falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Quincy stares at her, completely thrown.  It's been five years.  An awkward beat. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  I heard you were in Spain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see your peach fuzz finally grew in. Quincy rubs his goatee self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just something I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it looks good.  I mean, it's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Quincy tries to adjust his footing and flinches in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be lying down, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright.  But you can sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  My dad said you tore your ACL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the doctors saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of things.  All I know is I'll be back in six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought a torn ACL was ten to twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for Quincy McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot, "Q-man." An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how's pro-ball, Europe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won the championship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still working on being the first girl in the NBA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I tried sneaking in after college, but they found breasts during my physical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny.  I never did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass. Monica cracks up.  Quincy laughs with her. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it's been five years. Quincy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried calling you a couple times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to give you props on making First Team All-American.  And then when Magic retired, I tried calling you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been my cheap-ass answering machine.  It was always messing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured it was something like that. They look at each other.  The moment is building. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when do you go back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of playing overseas.  Thinking about giving it a rest for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely thrown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Basketball just, isn't fun anymore.  You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He stares at her.  Into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy! Quincy and Monica turn, as KYRA KESSLER, black, 26 and beautiful, rushes into the room.  She wears a flight attendant's uniform.  She goes to Quincy, gives him a kis Monica reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.  No one would switch flights with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you up?  Get in bed. She takes Quincy's arm, moves him to the bed.  Monica watches. KYRA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you're going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be okay. Kyra relaxes.  Then she glances over at Monica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyra, this is Monica.  She, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica.  You grew up together, right? Quincy's told me about you. Monica smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Kyra.  My fiance. The shock hits too quick to cover.  But Monica tries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiance.  Wow.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know.  Wow.  That's great. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means a lot that you came by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and Quincy, good luck with your knee, and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Monica forces one last smile, pulls open the door and lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica walks down the hall, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille moves between the counter and the stove, whipping a couple pecan pies.  Monica enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can manage. Monica nods and moves to the barstool. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister's bringing the baby over. You should try to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Can't wait to see him (she falls silent, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To that stewardess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you met her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother had a cookout a few weeks ago. He could do a lot better if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she is. Camille looks up, studies Monica for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were over him. Monica shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out where they're registered and send them a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want my opinion in the first place, so why even ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked but why does it always have to be so damn prissy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to tell you, Monica, to go beat that girl up?  To go have sex with him?  I'm not going to do that. Yes, I believe thinking of other people is important and yes I'd rather bake a pie than shoot a dumb jump shot.  If that makes me too "prissy" for you, too bad. Monica stares at her mother.  There's no going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's why we can't get along? Because I'd rather shoot a "dumb" jump shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one always turning your nose up at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child, please.  Ever since you were little you thought you were too good for anything I had to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't Lena.  I didn't care about nail polish or lip gloss or sneaking a spray of your perfume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was so wrong with wanting to teach you the things I knew could help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're pushing me to be something I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're angry with me because you're standing here with your hair combed and wearing perfume? Monica is busted.  It takes her a moment to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm angry because I want a mother, not Martha Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  The superstar female athlete whose mother is nothing but a housewife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you aren't ashamed of that because I know. Monica stares at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when I was eight years old, you spent like four hours cooking up this fancy meal.  All you'd let me and Lena do was set the table.  And I guess you and Dad got your wires crossed or something because he walks in with a couple of pizzas.  And you didn't say anything. You just threw the whole meal into some tupper-ware and tossed it in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.  You never stood up for yourself. Ever.  If I was ashamed, it was because of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's ridiculous is not being a caterer so your husband can feel like a man knowing his woman's home cooking and ironing his drawers. WHAP!  Camille's humiliation is immediate and she cuts of Monica with a SLAP.  Camille curses herself for losing it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammitt, Monica! Monica is stunned, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Camille stares at her daughter, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really all you think of me? Monica can't answer. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I married your father, all I wanted was a nice house with a big kitchen so I could start my catering business.  And then I got pregnant with Lena, and then I got pregnant with you.  And I put it out of my mind because that's what you did. Monica stares at her mother. CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you want to know what day I remember? In high school, you getting ready for the Spring Dance.  I put my pearls around your neck, told you you were beautiful and you looked like you were going to cry.  That day I was happy I didn't have a catering business to run off to.  My family had three meals a day, had someone to pick up after them, and when my daughters went to a dance, I helped them get ready.  That's what I came to care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you cared about.  I must have played in a thousand games and I can only remember you being to two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your coaches and your father for that stuff.  It never mattered one way or the other if I went to your games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It mattered, Mom. Camille looks at her daughter and is struck by the need i her eyes.  Monica moves off the barstool and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room looks exactly the same.  Trophies, medals, plaqu Basketball posters and her "strong women" wall. Monica sits on her bed, staring up at a photo of her and Quincy, tacked up to her bulletin board, amid other photo her childhood.  THEY ARE EIGHTEEN, PLAYFULLY WRESTLING OV BASKETBALL. Monica slowly rises, starts taking her posters down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy sits on a leg extension machine, with his left leg tucked under the padded bar.  A TRAINER stands behind him Sweat and pain coat Quincy's face and scarred knee as he slowly lifts the light weight again, and again, and again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of customers shift impatiently during the noo time rush. Monica sits with a BANK MANAGER at the "New Accounts" des learning the ropes.  Her hair is done, she wears a simple dress.  Behind her, hanging on the wall, are three framed photos of the bank presidents.  ONE OF THEM IS HER FATHER NATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica stands in her room, staring out at Quincy's window She watches as Quincy and Kyra pack up some of Quincy's stuff.  Quincy tries to take his basketball globe light. laughs, "Hell no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille enters, moves to Monica's garbage can, dumps the contents into her larger bag.  Suddenly, she stops.  She reaches into the garbage and pulls out a crumpled picture Camille smooths it.  It is the photo of Monica and Quincy eighteen, wrestling over a basketball.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE STARES AT IT, TAKEN IN BY THE PURE JOY IN HER
dialogues.text: DAUGHTER'S FACE.  She sits down on Monica's bed, still staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the empty gym, Quincy jogs up and down the court.  He still tentative on his knee, but he keeps jogging. And then, slowly, the determination melts from his face. jog turns into a walk, and then he just...stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy stands in the middle of his room, taking in his li Old, worn basketball posters still line the walls.  Troph and awards.  USC memorabilia.  His basketball globe light He walks to his window, looks out at Monica's window.  He room is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy tilts his face up to the shower head and rinses th soap from his face.  He hears the bathroom door open.  He shuts off the water and opens the curtain. Kyra sits on the toilet, taking a pee.  Quincy slams the curtain closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get used to it, babe. She flushes.  Quincy steps out, grabs a towel.  A long sc runs across his knee cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother's gonna have to start locking doors. Kyra laughs as she buttons up her flight attendant's unif They cross into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyra packs up a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long is this trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four days. Quincy nods. KYRA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you going to be the kind of husband who won't let his wife work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be the only one with a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, don't talk like that.  Your rehab's going well.  You'll be back before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if it's worth it. Busting my ass, for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To do what you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just scared.  I know rehab is hard, and you have to worry about whether you'll be as good as you were but you will be.  I believe in you.  You just have to get back on the court.  Like you'd get back on a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make fun of me when I'm being wonderful and supportive. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You belong on the court.  Just like I belong in the stands, looking cute and cheering you on. She smiles, gives him a kiss, moves back to her packing. Quincy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits at her desk in a blouse and skirt, punching numbers into the computer.  A man sits down in the chair opposite her.  Monica glances up.  It's her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, munchkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was upstairs for a meeting.  I've been hearing good things about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tends to happen when you're the boss's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's the job going? Monica forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Nathan looks at her, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what the problem is. He pulls a GARBAGE CAN HOOP from a plastic shopping bag. Monica smiles.  He attaches it to her garbage can. NATHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. He shoots an ugly, imaginary shot.  She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoot like a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that as a compliment. He gives her a smile, and exits.  Monica looks at the hoo then crumples a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she gets the steal.  Monica goes one- on-one against Jordan, she stops, pops... Monica shoots.  The paper drops through the net. MONICA (cont'd) (still whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good!  It's good! She glances up, notices a few patrons watching her.  Moni quickly composes herself and goes back to her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica exits her car, after a long day at work.  She wear very low heels.  But she still stumbles.  She curses, the hears a laugh. She looks up - Quincy sits on the grassy hill above her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when your mom had to beat you into a dress. Monica smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You visiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyra's gone for a couple days.  Figured I'd keep Mom company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this guy I always see her around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl.  He's alright, kinda corny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...how's the knee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong enough to get you down the aisle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Two weeks. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get to send you an invitation, but if you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  I'm probably, you know, busy. Quincy nods.  Awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? Monica looks at him. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never told me why ball isn't fun anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm kinda feeling that way, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a rough couple years, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a nice way of saying I rode the bench?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you tore up your knee.  Rehab is tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I haven't dribbled a ball in four and a half months.  Maybe I miss some of the attention, but besides that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like I needed a ball when I was trying to be like my pops...or trying to be better than him.  Now, I kinda think I need to try something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe go back to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Monica stares at him, seeing a man in the boy she grew up with.  Quincy looks away, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Kyra hasn't heard the school thing yet. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll probably say it's the painkillers talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trip, you know?  When you're a kid, you see the life you want, and it never crosses your mind that it's not gonna turn out that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why'd you give up ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep asking me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something was just missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Monica is too hurt, too scared to tell him the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, alright.  Just leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find. Monica turns, crosses to her house.  She stumbles on her heels, kicks them off in frustration, and exits inside. Quincy walks back to his curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille watches from the kitchen window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lena sits next to Camille.  Her one year old son, L.P., s on the ground at her feet.  Monica sits quietly nearby, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're still breast-feeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said it was okay.  Anyway, I'm still trying to lose some of this baby fat. She quickly looks over at Monica. LENA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Monica gives her a small smile.  Camille looks down at L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to put a jacket on him, it's getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Lena sighs, rolls her eyes.  She picks up her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, L.P.  Grandma says it's too cold. She exits inside.  Camille makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.  "Grandma." Monica smiles.  And then silence.  There is still so much distance between them, so many misunderstanding.  Camille stares at her daughter.  And then... CAMILLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'd probably be a lot more "prissy" in the situation than you'd like, but the thing I always admired that drove me crazy, was the fight you had in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I said Quincy could do better, I was thinking about you. Monica stares at her mom.  Camille stands and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica lies in her bed, staring up at the ceiling, unable sleep.  Her mind races with thoughts of her past, her choices, her future... Suddenly, she climbs out of bed.  She wears a tank-top an pajama bottoms.  She crosses to her window, pulls it open climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica drops down.  She moves to Quincy's window and knoc quietly.  Beat, then Quincy appears.  Bare-chested and in pair of shorts.  He looks at her, then pulls open the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-asleep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Quincy just looks at her. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Quincy disappears for a moment, then returns, pulling on shirt.  He climbs out of his window, drops to the ground. Quincy looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked me what was missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you woke me up to tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fun for me anymore because you're missing. Quincy stares at her. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm trying to say is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm trying to say is, I've loved you since I was eleven and the shit won't go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't talked since college and now you wait two weeks before my wedding to say something like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I probably should have said it two weeks ago. Quincy doesn't even crack a smile.  In fact, he glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't changed.  You still think the sun rises and sets on your ass.  Well, guess what, it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you so upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you don't pull this on someone who's about to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better late than never, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. Quincy starts back toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll play you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One game.  One-on-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart. Quincy looks at her in disbelief, then laughs at the absurdity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're gonna bitch up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to be, psychology?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why you broke up with me in college.  And not that what you did wasn't messed up, but what I did was, too.  So if you forgive me, I'll forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica, after that stuff with my dad, I couldn't trust anybody, okay.  I mean, I was lost.  So you are forgiven.  But that was five years ago.  I moved on. Monica moves past him, reaches through his window.  She d back down, holding his basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it. She throws him the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will this prove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You once said the reason I beat you was because you wanted me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if I win it's because deep down you know you're about to make the biggest mistake of your life, and deep down your want me to stop you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens when you lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I lose, I'll buy you a wedding present. Quincy stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica stands opposite Quincy.  Both are suited up in basketball gear. They stare at each other, ready to go to war. Monica toss him the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check. Quincy tosses the ball back.  Monica drives.  Quincy's kn is maybe at sixty percent and he can't keep up.  She scor easily. She walks to the top of the driveway, tosses him the ball MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, zip.  Check. Quincy rubs his scarred knee, then passes it back. The game continues.  Monica owns the first five points ea by exploiting Quincy's injury. Monica drives for another lay-up.  Quincy suddenly lets g his fear, leaps and swats her shot. He grabs the rebound and lays it up.  He nods intensely, he grabs the ball and walks back to the top of the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, five.  Check. The game continues and now Quincy has the upper-hand, usi his size and strength.  He scores seven straight points. The score stays close.  It is a sexually-charged battle o wills -- Quincy pulls off his sweat-soaked shirt.  Their bodies collide as they wrestle for the ball.  Monica yank off her jersey in frustration.  Her ass bumps into his hi as she backs him in.  Her hands slide across his chest as guards him... Finally, the score hits nine, nine.  Monica slowly walks the top of the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine, up.  Point. She tosses Quincy the ball. MONICA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check. Quincy tosses the ball back, drops low on defense.  Monic fakes an outside shot and Quincy bites.  Monica drives ar him.  SHE HAS A WIDE-OPEN LAY-UP.  SHE PUTS IT UP..AND IT ROLLS OFF THE RIM.  Monica can't believe it. Quincy grabs the loose ball and clears it.  He stares at Monica as he dribbles in front of her.  She stares back. He breaks for the basket.  Monica stays with him.  He goe up.  Monica jumps, desperately tries to block his shot. Quincy dunks on her, knocking her to the ground.  He lets of the rim, and tumbles to the ground also.  GAME OVER. Silence.  Quincy stares at her.  Monica looks back.  Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All's fair in love and basketball, right? Monica struggles to fight back her tears as she picks her She slowly walks back toward her house.  And then: QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Monica slowly stops, turns. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double or nothing. Monica stares at him, wonders if she heard right.  Quincy limps to his feet, picks up the ball and holds it out to Monica slowly walks back to him.  They stare at each othe No more egos, no more bullshit.  Just love. In the moonlight, on the blacktop, they kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music is blasting, banners are waving, crowd is screaming Magic Johnson sits in a floor seat, watching the game.  A REPORTER interviews him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Magic, are you contemplating another comeback?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more comebacks.  Tonight I'm just enjoying being a spectator. Behind him, in a second row seat, a ONE YEAR BLACK GIRL s in a lap, bouncing, watching feet and legs ballin' on the court. Quincy leans down, gives the little girl a kiss, then loo out at the court.  It's the Los Angeles Sparks and the Ne York Liberty.  The WNBA. On the court, the women line up for a free-throw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, McCall! Monica, sporting a uniform with Wright-McCall on the back the number thirty-two, looks over.  Quincy takes their daughter's hand and waves it. QUINCY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Mommy. Monica smiles back, then steps to the line.  The referee tosses her the ball.  Monica stares at the basket, then bounces the ball twice, licks her lips and shoots.
